result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Moved, left no forwarding address.  JOC

Defendant Joseph M Johnson in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF19, 15CM39, 15CT66.  Agreement has been reached in all matters.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

14CT66-DRI
15CM39-DRI
15CF7- DE will enter  a plea to Ct 1, Ct's 2,3 will be DRI.  CT 1-DE will enter a plea of NC, court accepts and finds DE guilty.


15CF19-DE will enter a plea to Ct 1, repeater will be dismissed.  Ct's 2,3 will be DRI.  Ct 1- DE enters a plea of NC, court accepts, finds DE guilty.  

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  
Court orders sentence withheld on both counts, 3 yrs probation.  DE will pay restitution of $4068.11-  J/S in 15CF7, CC, complete any programming ordered by DOC, maintain absolute sobriety,  no alcohol, drugs, no mind altering substances.  43 days credit.  DE informed of appeal rights.
NO ALCOHOL POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION.  NO ENTERING PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS THE PRIMARY BUSINESS.  NO CONTACT WITH MARK NUESSLE.

Defendant Joseph M Johnson in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF7, 15CF19, 15CM39(Init App).  15CM39-waive reading, enter a plea of NG.  Bond will be concurrent with other cases.  
15CF19-Waiver of preliminary hearing filed by Atty/DE.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim hearing.  Court will accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause exists,  will bind over.  Will proceed to arraignment- Waive reading of Information, enter plea of NG.  Set for 6-09-15 @ 10:00AM.
